meanings.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to one thousandth of a mole.
meanings.sent1: I added one millimole of sugar to the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the millimole of salt in the solution.
meanings.sent3: The tiny millimole of flour tried to escape from the measuring cup.
meanings.sent4: Each millimole of water in the glass sparkled like a tiny gem.
meanings.sent5: The millimole of medicine in the syringe was carefully injected into the patient's arm.

meanings.definition: A millimole of a substance is equivalent to its molecular weight in milligrams.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist carefully measured out a millimole of the medication.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician calculated the millimole of oxygen in the sample.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous millimole of sugar spilled all over the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The millimole of knowledge in his mind expanded with each new book he read.
meanings.sent5: She felt the weight of each millimole of responsibility on her shoulders.
